author: B. Virtuous Earth
text: 'I arrived to this location at 9 pm because per THIS website the Hoboken location closes at 10pm. According to the automated voice when you call
column5: they also state they close at 10 pm.  However

author: Jason G
text: "Could quite possibly be the worst Panera in America. Their delivery drivers constantly leave orders unattended in building lobbies regardless of clear order instructions stating to not do so. Don't even bother trying to get a manager on the phone
column5: because nobody ever picks up the phone at this location. Corporate really needs to step in."

author: Samsebeskazal Denis
text: "Worst service I have received in all Panera Bread restaurants.  Made an order with three bowls of soup and got only one. Asked where the other bowls were and they told me to wait at the pick up area. 10 minutes passed and they still hadn't made the bowls of soup.  Had to ask them about it again. It turns out that they had forgotten about it again! I don't want to wait 20 minutes for soup
column5: especially when I come with two hungry kids. Oh and also all the food got cold over those 20 minutes that I waited for the soup."

author: F G
text: 'For this covid pandemic they are taking great measurements. Noone without a mask is allowed and you can use an app or an ipad to get your stuff'

author: Tim Golding

author: J B
text: 'If I could give them 0 stars

column6: and they still haven’t brought the order. They won’t answer their phones. Never again! Wawa would be better than them!!'

text: "Ordered on their app for delivery.  Over an hour later the food never came. Been on hold for Panera's Customer Service line for over 10 minutes and still waiting.  I just want a refund
column5: I don't want the food anymore.  I don't recommend their delivery service."

author: Michael Sojka
text: 'Basically a daycare/teenage hangout spot. By no fault of Panera’s
column5: this location was just overrun with 13 year olds for about 3 hours. Yelling
column6: playing music
column8: and the staff didn’t seem to notice or care. Lot of people were trying to eat and/or work but couldn’t effectively. Feel bad for the people working here

author: AnnaMarie Suozzo
text: 'First time ever leaving a negative review on Google but wow. Ordered delivery
column5: order was missing two items from the bakery
column6: two beverages
column7: and one side...literally missing 5/7 items in the order. Tried to call and nobody answered so I left to walk to the store to get the items. I assumed nobody was answering because they were swamped
column9: walked into the store and there are barely and costumers. Told them what I was missing
column10: they asked me to repeat it 3 times
column12: and then gave me a bag full of what was missing. Get back to my apartment only to find out that that they didn’t put one of the two missing baked goods in the bag. Partially my fault for not checking since apparently their combined IQ couldn’t provide enough power to lightly toast a slice of bread.'

author: Kyle Weber
text: 'I wanted to dislike this place — mainly because I am annoyed by any fast casual restaurant that charges the prices of a restaurant with waiter service — but it nevertheless won me over.  The Mac and Cheese is enjoyable if a bit staid
column5: the chips end up being a cut above Lay’s and Pringle’s
column6: and the kitchen sink cookie was reminiscent of Momofuku Milk Bar’s Compost cookie (in other words
column7: really really good but also sold at a premium price).  None of this is world-changing and the prices are higher than I would like for a chain with no waiter service and a limited cafe menu
column8: but the environment is comfortable enough and the food tasty enough to make this place comfortable in its own way.   A few more visits like my last one here and I’ll call myself a fan of the chain.'

author: Joseph Fortunato
text: 'Great place'

author: Reggie Bourdeau
text: 'Always want to be critical of Panera but somehow they always surprise me with awesomeness...especially the Hoboken location....'

text: 'First time today I ordered from here in Hoboken. The door dash delivery person arrived with the wrong order when I just spent $20 on a delivery. (this was not her fault) HOWEVER
column5: I called Panera and spoke with a person name Joel who was very polite and understanding. He easily informed me he would remake my order and asked if I wanted it delivered or if I wanted to pick it up. What a great staff member! Proper way to handle the situation and come up with a quick resolution! Way to go JOEL!'

author: Gordon Myers
text: "Yesterday
column5: upon entering Panera
column6: I noticed that there was a man sitting with quite a few shopping bags.  After getting something to eat and coffee
column7: I then noticed I sat right across from a lady with tons of bags and as soon as she turned around my stomach turned
column8: she was dirty and had a huge tumor on her head.  As I left I noticed another man with bags; these are street people and should not have been in the restaurant. Why doesn't Panera do something about this.  One cannot enjoy their meal without\nthat horrid smell.  These homeless people in a restaurant. Unbelievable.  Will never go into Panera again and I have told so many people about this incident.  Disgusting..I do feel sorry for the homeless
column9: and something must be done about this as well in Hoboken
column10: as they are often in the waiting room of the train station.  Hoboken

text: "Food is what you'd expect from a chain restaurant. There are better places in Hoboken for sandwiches
column5: salads
column6: and soups
column7: but it's decent. The bakery items are better.\nThe inside presents a decent place to study
column8: but can get very loud and hard to concentrate. Also
column9: patrons tend to leave their used plates at their seats even after they leave
column10: so sometimes you'll have to bus your own tables. Panera staff do go around cleaning the tables and floors
column11: but it's not as frequent as the customers timings.\nFree WiFi is actually pretty good

text:
'(Translated by Google) Very rich

author: Leon Cal
text:
'I usually get coffee here which was good. Today I decided to get their chicken soup and went with a bowl wanting obviously eat more lol.
So it was a bowl and a small coffee that I ordered. However the cashier charged me for a soda instead of a small coffee which she then gave me a large cup of coffee to make up for the minor error which is fine.

I got my food order ringer and waited by my table to get my food delivered nearly 15 Minutes later I went to check in and nothing still. They seemed a little busy so I didn’t make much of it however 5 minutes later still nothing and eventually I saw them put what looked like chicken noodle soup on the counter
column5: idk if it was mine but I asked and I took it and boy was that soup serving really really small for a “bowl” serving.\n\nBut then again I barely order Panera food and I guess small servings is there thing ? Anyways I’ll still come back but just to get coffee. Other than this minor experience it’s still a good place to chill and read.'

author: cesar luis
text:
'(Translated by Google) Very well attended

(Original)
Muy bien atendidos'

author: Valerie Yeo
text: "Fresh bread and good coffee. Love the service too. Always friendly and everyone that comes in seems to be a regular. I've always love their chocolate chip muffie. Good place for breakfast even if you have little one in tow."

author: Lizeth Pascua
text: 'Very dissatisfied. Service was slow at register

text: "I love Paneras but it has become too pricey. No longer a healthy alternative for the budget conscience.\nI saw a couple people buy Mc Donalds food and come into Panera to sit. I think that's rude but it's just too expensive."

author: Michael T Goodside
text: 'Good food.  Reasonable prices.  I cannot really comment on the quality of the service to folks who choose to use the registers
column5: as I regularly use the mobile or online ordering
column6: but my orders are usually ready at my requested times and fresh enough to eat right away.  If you live or work in the downtown part of Hoboken
column7: this is usually a good choice for a cup of coffee or quick bite to eat.'

text: "The tomato soup here kinda tastes like they warmed up a bottle of Prego and dumped it inside a hallowed loaf of bread. Pretty disappointed since I could've sworn it used to taste better..."

author: wallnutts23
text: 'I came to this Panera Bread location about a month ago and really enjoyed my experience. Clean and spacious. The food was great . I ordered a sweet onion and cheese steak sandwich with a cheese and broccoli soup with the bread and all . There is a big difference in quality when eating here and fast food restaurant . I choose Panera Bread ! and when I signed up for a Panera Bread reward card
column5: I got a free ( pastry) sweet ! It was starting to get a little busy when I was leaving. Saturday or Sunday afternoon around 3 pm. Great location ~ 5 stars ~'

author: John Keegan
text: "Every time I am dragged here by my wife I have a terrible experience. Today was choose not to order anything. My wife figured a coffee and chocolate cruisant could not be an issue.\nCoffee (dark blend) empty again. Cruisant we have to microwave yourself. I over heated it and chocolate ran out.  After coffee refilled no whole milk. I go out to have food and drink prepared. This dump you make your own coffee and drink.  Heating a basic item which is done everywhere but here is a failure.\nI have asked my wife never to select Panera with me. After this failure again ( Over 10 attempts I am never give g this business another dime. Besides it's a haven for Simi homeless."

author: Stephen Forte
text: 'Got a free thing today.'

author: W.20Th!
text: 'I took Yummy Panera Cinnamon raisin loaf bread and turned it into chalas cinnamon french toast...The bomb!!!'

author: Anatoli Karotki
text: 'This is a great place where you can eat delicious and inexpensive. Polite staff
column5: unlimited soda / lemonade / tea / coffee. Very delicious pastries - we especially come here for bread and candy cookies.'

author: evelyn garcia
text: 'Hit or miss with the food.'

author: Corey Frantz
text: 'Panera bread employees are always so friendly. Service is quick if outside major lunch hours.'

author: Xiao-fang Ruan
text: "Love their soups! Their drinks are good as well. Make sure you track your calories though because it's a lot!"

author: Jiaren Li
text: "Overall no major complaints. It offers food that met expectations and has plenty of space for meetups of various sized groups. Can get chaotic on occasions especially if there is a lot of people.\nAlso on the rare chance you get bread that came straight out of the oven
column5: that's how a day is made."

author: Johnny Melendez
text: 'Love the you pick 2'

text: 'I love their menu
column5: and especially the option to order using tablets
column6: it is really a revolutionary experience.'

text: 'Great service
column5: clean comfortable'

text:

(Original)
Excelente'

text: 'Quick and easy'

author: Elisa Palacios
text: 'Love Panera. This location didn’t have my favorite butternut squash soup but it was still good Panera.'

Buen servicio y comida'

author: Albert Avi Alaluf
text: 'Great tomato soup on bread bowl'

author: Jacob Schnabel
text: "I love panera and they always get your order right. In the rare occasions where they don't get it right they are very happy to correct it."

author: Subramanian Subramanian
text: 'Lived with this
column5: while in US...'

author: Luke Vanderberg
text: 'This Panera bread is my extended office. I work from home and when I need a change of scenery I come here.\nTruth be told I’m not crazy about Panera food
column5: but I love Panera bread ice tea.\n\nThe staff is friendly
column6: there is plenty of seating
column7: and you are welcome to stay as long as you’d like.'

author: Nick Lenzi
text: "This is one of the few spots in Hoboken where you can have a meeting or study. I'm not a big fan of their food
column5:
their eggs and their chicken always seem under seasoned and rubbery to me. They of course have tons of bakery items that are delicious. They also have a few good soups. I like their french onion when they have it.

The problem though is the management of this place. There's no order in the establishment. There seems to be people who are in there the entire day and they hog the outlets. Doesn't even matter if you get there at 6am when they open they'll still be there taking up all the outlets.

It can also get very loud in this place so bring a pair of good headphones with you."

author: Josefina Santos Suriel
text: 'Big place with lots of seating space and great service.'

author: Jose Acevedo
text: "Panera's is usually great food and great service but lately that has not been our experience I am a student at Stevens Tech and along with my fellow students we always order from Panera's delivery now usually we get a lovely woman named Maria Garcia but I last few deliveries have been made by a man and with his appearance and lack of cleanliness has been a turn off not sure if it's just a mental thing but seeing his dirty appearance making the deliveries has made the food tastes a little bit different we have been on the fence on asking Panera's to send Maria and not this guy but we're not sure what kind of effect that would have like I said earlier food is great service is great but lately hasn't been the same"

author: Charles Sherwood
text: 'Nice concept executed in an average fashion'

author: jenn jenn
text: 'I LOVE THIS PLACE😢😢😢😢😢...BEST TURKEY SANDWICH EVER .......'

text: '(Translated by Google) Excellent place to get a meal
